questions.question_text: The KV store forms its own cluster within a SHC. What is the maximum number of SHC members KV store will form?

discussion.content: Answer is B, its limited to 50

Selected Answer: B
(Ref: 2023 Cluster Admin PDF â€“ p201)
SHC Max Members Ref.: 
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/DistSearch/SHCsystemrequirements#Maximum_number_of_instances:~:text=Search%20head%20clustering%20supports%20up%20to%2050%20members%20in%20a%20single%20cluster.
Answer is B - 50

Selected Answer: B
Cluster Admin pdf page 219

Selected Answer: B
B, because a search head cluster itself is limited to 50 members: https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.0.1/DistSearch/SHCsystemrequirements#Maximum_number_of_instances

Selected Answer: B
Pg 219/Cluster

Selected Answer: B
Yes B is correct
50 is correct
slide : 219 (Cluster) Within a SHC, the KV store forms its own cluster - Can use up to 50 SHC members

choices.C: Run the splunk transfer shcluster-captain command from the current captain.
choices.B: Use the Search Head Clustering settings menu from Splunk Web on any member.
choices.D: Run the splunk transfer shcluster-captain command from the member you would like to become the captain.

discussion.content: BCD is the answer

I think, its C and D
To Transfer the captainancy to a preffered member, run this command from any member: 
splunk transfer shcluster-captain -mgmt_uri <new_captain> ....

Additions: Splunk rollling-restart shcluster-members automatically invokkes the captainancy transfer. To check the transfer status, run this from any member: splunk show shcluster-status

Selected Answer: BC
Change the captain
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/DistSearch/Transfercaptain#Transfer_captaincy

Selected Answer: CD
B+C+D
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/DistSearch/Transfercaptain#Change_the_captain

1.To transfer captaincy to a different member, run this command from any member:
 splunk transfer shcluster-captain -mgmt_uri <URI>:<management_port> -auth <username>:<password> Answer D
2.You can run this command from any member. You are not limited to running it from the current captain or the intended captain.
 You are not limited to running it from the current captain means, we can run the command from the current captain Answer C
 
3. You can also transfer captaincy through the search head clustering dashboard in Settings. See Use the search head clustering dashboard. Answer B

Final Answer: BCD

https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/DistSearch/Transfercaptain#Change_the_captain

BCD
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.0.5/DistSearch/Transfercaptain

its BCD,

B C D - there is no mention of the full command to run, just that you _do_ run transfer shcluster-captain (with the mgmt_uri parameter) and that can be done on any of the cluster members including the captain.

choices.D: This instance is missing the master_uri attribute.
choices.C: This Splunk instance needs to be restarted.

questions.question_text:
A Splunk instance has the following settings in SPLUNK_HOME/etc/system/local/server.conf:
[clustering]
mode = master
replication_factor = 2
pass4SymmKey = password123
Which of the following statements describe this Splunk instance? (Select all that apply.)

comments.content: Perhaps because the password is in "raw" format, if the instance was restarted, the password will be a hash value...
why C? Why do we need to restart the server?

discussion.content: Answer is B and C
this instance is a master, so master uri is not required, search factor is not set, so it will take the default value which is 2
D Cannot be the answer master_uri feature is deprecated instead use manager_uri

Selected Answer: BC
According to this documentation:
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.1.2/Indexer/Thesearchfactor
And also this one:
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.1.3/Admin/Serverconf

splunk has a default search_factor = 2

So answer B seems to be also correct.

C is correct, because the password is in clear text and it should be encrypted by restarting the instance.

Selected Answer: BC
B/C since master_uri is deprecated correct attribute should be 'manager_uri'

Splunk Cluster Admin pdf => pg 30
Splunk defaults to replication_factor = 3
search_factor = 2

https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.1.1/Security/Aboutsecuringclusters
When you edit the server.conf file to specify or change a pass4SymmKey, the Splunk platform encrypts the key in the server.conf file after you restart. Remember your key in plaintext, as it is very difficult to recover the key if you forget it.

Correct Answer: B & C
The answer is B&C. Cluster pdf page no:30 (configuring Splunk master node)
B is not true, SF can be defined somewhere else

Selected Answer: BC
B and C

Selected Answer: BC
Answer is B and C. https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.2.4/DistSearch/Transfercaptain#Transfer_captaincy

Selected Answer: BC
pg 193/Cluster & https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.2.4/DistSearch/Transfercaptain#Transfer_captaincy
BC 100% Sure

comments.content:
If you don't specify a search factor or replication factor, the defaults are used. 
They are:
Replication factor - 3
Search factor - 2

In this example, you will have a RF=2 and a SF=2

discussion.content: B is wrong because search factor is not necessarilly replication factor
B and C

questions.question_text: A customer has installed a 500GB Enterprise license. They also purchased and installed a 300GB, no enforcement license on the same license master. How much data can the customer ingest before search is locked out?

choices.D: Search is not locked out. Violations are still recorded.
choices.A: 300GB. After this limit, search is locked out.
choices.C: 800GB. After this limit, search is locked out.
choices.B: 500GB. After this limit, search is locked out.

discussion.content:
Answer is D. Based on the document:
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Admin/Aboutlicenseviolations
Splunk Enterprise license An Enterprise license stack with a license volume of 100 GB of data per day or more does not currently violate.
D for sure

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
D is the correct
